We are seeking a Head of Search → engineering leader to architect, scale, and own the core systems that power Ema’s Search platform. This role is especially critical to building and scaling:

 - Own the technical roadmap for Search at Ema → this includes
   
   - Core Search Platform
   
   - Integrations internally with other application teams
   
   - Integrations with partner teams
   
   - Open API specs to bring in the data into Ema

 - Set the roadmap for our Data Ingestion Platform – which enables Ema to securely ingest, transform, and index data from documents, spreadsheets, emails, and SaaS systems.

 - Our Application Integration Platform – which connects Ema to hundreds of third-party APIs, allowing our agents to act across CRMs, ITSMs, HRIS platforms, and more.

 - Design and scale our Search Platform, enabling structured and unstructured data to flow seamlessly into Ema for search, reasoning, and generation.

 - Own the architecture and implementation of Ema’s Search Index.

 - Drive and collaborate with the LLMOps infrastructure: influence on how 1000s of transforms can be developed by external folks as well.

 - Ensure platform support for diverse data formats (PDFs, spreadsheets, databases, charts, etc.) using PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch, and other relevant tools.


REQUIRED SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS

 - Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.

 - 12+ years of experience in backend systems, lucene, elastic search, vector datastores, infrastructure and scale.

 - Knowledge of indexing strategies, inverted indexes, sharding/replication, and managing large document corpora.
   
   - Expertise in ranking algorithms (BM25, vector-based, hybrid).
   
   - Familiarity with relevance tuning, query understanding, and search result evaluation.
   
   - Proficiency with metrics (precision, recall, NDCG, MRR, etc.).

 - Proven experience in building the search infrastructure and scaling real-time systems on the search engine.

 - Deep understanding of knowledge search

 - Deep expertise in cloud-native architecture, containerized services, and microservice orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes).

 - Solid understanding of LLM-based pipelines, knowledge retrieval, and secure document processing.

 - Strong experience with data systems like PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch, and Redis.


WHY JOIN EMA?

 - Work at the forefront of agentic AI systems—driving real enterprise transformation.

 - Own mission-critical platforms that make or break Ema’s capabilities.

 - Join an elite team of engineers, product thinkers, and AI researchers who value deep execution.

 - Help define the architectural, cultural, and operational DNA of a company set to define a new category.


EMA’S CULTURE & VALUES

 - High Bar on Quality – We value excellence and expect world-class execution.

 - Ownership & Accountability – We take full responsibility for our work and outcomes.

 - Impact-Driven Approach – We set ambitious goals and measure success through real-world impact.

 - Team Collaboration & Growth – We believe in continuous learning, knowledge sharing, and supporting each other.

 - No Hierarchy, Just Execution – Everyone is an individual contributor, focused on delivering results.

Join Ema and lead a team committed to delivering powerful, hands-on AI solutions that transform enterprise workflows.

jobs.title: Enterprise Sales Leader
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Ema

Ema is building the world’s largest agentic AI platform to revolutionize enterprise productivity. Our proprietary technology enables companies to delegate repetitive tasks to Ema, the Universal AI employee, unlocking 10x gains in workforce efficiency. Founded by ex-Google, Coinbase, Flipkart, and Okta executives, we bring deep product and scaling expertise to this mission. Our team includes top engineers from Google, Microsoft Research, Facebook, Square, and Coinbase, and alumni of Stanford, MIT, UC Berkeley, CMU, and IITs.

We’ve raised over $61M from top-tier investors including Accel, Naspers/Prosus, Section32, SCB10X, Sozo Ventures, Hitachi Ventures, and prominent angels like Sheryl Sandberg, Jerry Yang, and Dustin Moskovitz. Ema is headquartered in Silicon Valley with a second hub in Bangalore, India.

Role Overview:

This role is responsible for driving new business and revenue growth by acquiring new enterprise customers with deal sizes exceeding 7 figures in many cases, while also expanding the footprint within existing accounts through upselling, cross-selling, and maximizing customer lifetime value. The leader will have the opportunity to build and scale a high-performing sales team, establish a demand-driven sales model, and implement scalable processes, metrics, and tools to ensure efficiency, accurate forecasting, and predictable growth. Success will come from leveraging all pipeline channels—Direct, Partnerships, and Marketing—while maintaining a strong focus on reducing deal cycle times and improving sales efficiency.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Drive new business by acquiring large enterprise customers

  • Build and maintain a healthy pipeline at 4X the revenue target to ensure consistent deal flow.

  • Expand revenue within existing accounts through upselling, cross-selling, and positioning the full Emma platform.

  • Own customer lifetime value (CLV) by focusing on long-term relationships and revenue growth.

  • Develop and implement a demand-driven sales model aligned with company growth goals.

  • Help hire, train, and manage a high-performing Account Executive team.

  • Define and track key sales metrics, targets, and quotas to drive accountability and performance.

  • Establish scalable sales processes including playbooks, CRM configuration, and effective sales enablement tools.

  • Leverage all revenue channels—Direct, Partnerships, and Marketing—to maximize pipeline generation.

  • Improve sales efficiency and reduce average deal cycle time.

  • Ensure accurate CRM utilization and data entry for reliable reporting and scalable operations.

  • Deliver accurate revenue and pipeline forecasts by maintaining a strong understanding of the customer journey and sales funnel.

Qualifications:

  • 6+ years of progressive sales experience in SaaS or technology, with at least 2+ years leading managers and teams.

  • Proven track record of consistently meeting or exceeding multi-million-dollar revenue targets.

  • Experience building, scaling, and managing high-performing sales teams.

  • Strong understanding of enterprise sales cycles, including deal structuring, forecasting, and pipeline management.

  • Demonstrated success in developing scalable sales processes, playbooks, and metrics-driven management.

  • Ability to attract, hire, and develop top sales talent.

  • Strong executive presence with excellent communication and negotiation skills, comfortable presenting to C-level stakeholders.

  • Data-driven leadership style, with proficiency in CRM tools (Hubspot) and sales analytics.

  • Ability to work cross-functionally with Marketing, Customer Success, and Product to drive revenue growth.

  • Willingness to travel as needed within the region to support customer and team engagements.

Compensation offered will be determined by factors such as location, level, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Certain roles may be eligible for variable compensation, equity, and benefits.

Ema Unlimited is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or genetics.

jobs.title: CTO's Office - AI Applications Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Who are we?

Ema is building the next generation AI technology to empower every employee in the enterprise to be their most creative and productive. Our proprietary tech allows enterprises to delegate most repetitive tasks to Ema, the Universal AI employee. We are founded by ex-Google, Coinbase, Okta executives, and serial entrepreneurs. We’re well-funded by the top investors and angels in the world. Ema is based in Silicon Valley and Bangalore.

Why does this role exist?

At Ema, we are not just building an AI product; we are building an AI-native organization from

the ground up. Our mission is to serve as a model for the future of work, leveraging artificial

intelligence to its fullest. We believe that the most valuable work is creative, strategic, and

uniquely human. Everything else must be done by AI.

To achieve this vision, we are building an elite team of AI Application Engineers in the CTO’s

Office to bring this vision to life. This team will envision, design & build Agentic AI tools to

fundamentally reshape how Ema operates - setting the bar for the post-AI era.

What is the role?

We are looking for a foundational member for a transformative team aimed at revolutionizing Ema using Agentic AI. This role is about reimagining the future of work and then bringing it to life.

You will be a hybrid of product manager, strategic thinker & engineer, with a mandate to

identify and solve problem statements with Agentic AI to deliver impact.

What you’ll do day to day?

1. Agentic AI Tool Building:

● You will serve as the Product Manager, Designer & Developer in building AI-powered tools

to streamline workflows for our teams and partners

● Develop Custom Software: Build AI-powered micro-SaaS tools and intelligent

applications to solve specific challenges across Ema

● Leverage Modern AI Tooling: Utilize the latest generation of AI-native development

tools (e.g., Cursor, Lovable etc.) and LLM frameworks to rapidly prototype, build, and

deploy valuable solutions.

2. Agentic Automation:

● Opportunity Discovery: Uncover problem statements for AI-driven automation across

our processes and architect AI agents to automate the work

● Deliver Impact: Leverage cutting-edge agentic workflow platforms—including our own

Ema platform in your journey to deliver value

Who We Are Looking For:

● High Agency: You love to operate independently and autonomously to create outsized impact

● A Builder at Heart: You have a demonstrable passion for creating things, whether it's

scripts, full-stack applications, or complex automated workflows. You likely have a

portfolio of projects you're proud of.

● Product Thinker: You love talking to users and understanding their pain-points then

designing solutions that suit them

● A First-Principles Thinker: You don't just solve the problem as it's presented. You dig

deep to understand the root cause and envision a completely new, more efficient way of

operating.

● AI-Curious & Rapid Learner: You are fascinated by the latest developments in AI, LLMs,

and agentic systems. You are not afraid to pick up new tools and technologies on the fly

to find the best solution for the problem at hand.

● Product-Minded: You have a keen sense for user experience and can build tools that are

not just functional but also intuitive and delightful for your internal customers.

Bonus Points

● Experience with no-code/low-code automation platforms (e.g., Zapier, Make, n8n).

● Familiarity with agentic AI frameworks like LangChain, AutoGen, or CrewAI.

● Familiarity with AI development tools (Lovable, Cursor, Copilot etc.)

Ema Unlimited is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or genetics.

jobs.title: Machine Learning Engineer - India
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Who we are

Ema is building the next generation AI technology to empower every employee in the enterprise to be their most creative and productive. Our proprietary tech allows enterprises to delegate most repetitive tasks to Ema, the AI employee. We are founded by ex-Google, Coinbase, Okta executives and serial entrepreneurs. We’ve raised capital from notable investors such as Accel Partners, Naspers, Section32 and a host of prominent Silicon Valley Angels including Sheryl Sandberg (Facebook/Google), Divesh Makan (Iconiq Capital), Jerry Yang (Yahoo), Dustin Moskovitz (Facebook/Asana), David Baszucki (Roblox CEO) and Gokul Rajaram (Doordash, Square, Google).

Our team is a powerhouse of talent, comprising engineers from leading tech companies like Google, Microsoft Research, Facebook, Square/Block, and Coinbase. All our team members hail from top-tier educational institutions such as Stanford, MIT, UC Berkeley, CMU and Indian Institute of Technology.  We’re well funded by the top investors and angels in the world. Ema is based in Silicon Valley and Bangalore, India. This will be a hybrid role where we expect employees to work from office three days a week.

Who you are

We're looking for an innovative and passionate Machine Learning Engineers to join our team. You are someone who loves solving complex problems, enjoys the challenges of working with huge data sets, and has a knack for turning theoretical concepts into practical, scalable solutions. You are a strong team player but also thrive in autonomous environments where your ideas can make a significant impact. You love utilizing machine learning techniques to push the boundaries of what is possible within the realm of Natural Language Processing, Information Retrieval and related Machine Learning technologies. Most importantly, you are excited to be part of a mission-oriented high-growth startup that can create a lasting impact.

You will:

  1. Conceptualize, develop, and deploy machine learning models that underpin our NLP, retrieval, ranking, reasoning, dialog and code-generation systems.

  2. Implement advanced machine learning algorithms, such as Transformer-based models, reinforcement learning, ensemble learning, and agent-based systems to continually improve the performance of our AI systems.

  3. Lead the processing and analysis of large, complex datasets (structured, semi-structured, and unstructured), and use your findings to inform the development of our models.

  4. Work across the complete lifecycle of ML model development, including problem definition, data exploration, feature engineering, model training, validation, and deployment.

  5. Implement A/B testing and other statistical methods to validate the effectiveness of models. Ensure the integrity and robustness of ML solutions by developing automated testing and validation processes.

  6. Clearly communicate the technical workings and benefits of ML models to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, facilitating understanding and adoption.

Ideally, you'd have:

  1. A Master’s degree or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related quantitative field.

  2. Proven industry experience in building and deploying production-level machine learning models.

  3. Deep understanding and practical experience with NLP techniques and frameworks, including training and inference of large language models.

  4. Deep understanding of any of retrieval, ranking, reinforcement learning, and agent-based systems and experience in how to build them for large systems.

  5. Proficiency in Python and experience with ML libraries such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.

  6. Excellent skills in data processing (SQL, ETL, data warehousing) and experience working with large-scale data systems.

  7. Experience with machine learning model lifecycle management tools, and an understanding of MLOps principles and best practices.

  8. Familiarity with cloud platforms like GCP or Azure.

  9. Familiarity with the latest industry and academic trends in machine learning and AI, and the ability to apply this knowledge to practical projects.

  10. Good understanding of software development principles, data structures, and algorithms.

  11. Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and a strong capacity for logical thinking.

  12. The ability to work collaboratively in an extremely fast-paced, startup environment.


Ema Unlimited is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or genetics.

jobs.title: Associate Product Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Ema

Ema is on a mission to redefine the future of work. We’re building the Universal AI Employee—a breakthrough platform that empowers every enterprise worker to focus on creativity, strategy, and innovation while delegating repetitive tasks to AI.

Founded by former leaders from Google, Coinbase, and Okta, and backed by the world’s top investors and operators, Ema is scaling rapidly from Silicon Valley to Bangalore. This is your opportunity to join a rocket-ship company at the forefront of the agentic AI revolution.

The APM Program

The Associate Product Manager (APM) program at Ema is a hands-on, accelerated pathway into product leadership in the world of generative AI and agentic systems. Unlike traditional PM tracks, you won’t just manage tickets—you’ll learn the full arc of product building, from 0 → 1 innovation to enterprise-scale rollout.

As an APM, you’ll:

  • Partner with world-class engineers and designers to shape next-generation AI products.

  • Work directly with enterprise customers to uncover real-world workflows and turn them into transformative AI solutions.

  • Gain deep exposure to B2B sales cycles, go-to-market strategy, and customer success.

  • Contribute to both the technical design and business impact of products that redefine how Fortune 500 companies operate.

This program is designed to transform ambitious builders into AI-native product leaders.

What You’ll Do

  • Build the Future: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, launch, and scale AI-powered products.

  • Think Like a Founder: Participate in every stage of the product lifecycle—ideation, design, prototyping, launch, and iteration.

  • Be Close to the Customer: Engage directly with enterprise users, uncover their workflows, and turn insights into product strategy.

  • Shape Strategy: Analyze trends, research competitive dynamics, and help craft the vision of AI employees across industries.

  • Drive Impact: Ensure your products aren’t just shipped, but truly deliver measurable outcomes for customers.

Who You Are

  • Early Career Builder: 0-2 years of experience post most recent degree, eager to learn and grow in product.

  • Problem-Solver: Demonstrated ability to take on complex challenges and ship real solutions.

  • AI Curious (and Serious): Passion for generative AI, agentic workflows, and the future of intelligent systems. Experience in building prototypes using AI is a plus.

  • Technical Credibility: Comfortable with engineering concepts; background in Computer Science, Data Science, or Engineering preferred.

  • Great Communicator: Collaborative, clear, and confident in working with diverse stakeholders.

Why Ema?

At Ema, you won’t just observe the AI revolution—you’ll help lead it. Our APM program is designed to give you:

  • Unparalleled Exposure: Work side-by-side with founders, senior PMs, and AI engineers.

  • Accelerated Growth: Learn the craft of product management in one of the most transformative industries of our time.

  • Real Ownership: You won’t just shadow—your work will directly shape live products in Fortune 500 enterprises.

  • Mission-Driven Team: Join a culture that values ambition, curiosity, and resilience while building tech that changes how the world works.

We’re not just building AI. We’re building the future of work. Come build it with us.

Ema is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

jobs.title: Visual Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Opportunity Summary:

Ema is building the next generation AI technology to empower every employee in the enterprise to be their most creative and productive. Our proprietary tech allows enterprises to delegate most repetitive tasks to Ema, the Universal AI employee. We are founded by ex-Google, Coinbase, Okta executives, and serial entrepreneurs. We’re well-funded by the top investors and angels in the world. Ema is based in Silicon Valley with offices in Bangalore. This will be a hybrid role where we expect employees to work from office three days a week.

In this role you will:

  • Marketing Design:

    • Develop creative concepts and designs for marketing materials such as technical blogs, sales brochures, product videos, social media graphics, and email campaigns.

    • Collaborate with the marketing team to understand campaign objectives and create designs that effectively communicate key messages and drive engagement.

    • Ensure all marketing materials adhere to brand guidelines and maintain consistency in style, tone, and visual identity.

    • Stay updated on design trends and best practices in marketing design to continuously improve the quality and effectiveness of our visual assets.

  • Product Design:

    • Collaborate with UX designers to infuse user requirements and product objectives into aesthetically pleasing and impactful visual designs. Focus on typography, graphic elements, and color schemes to create compelling visual narratives for the Ema web application.

    • Develop and refine visual assets such as icons, infographics, and layout structures, ensuring they align with brand standards and enhance overall user engagement.

    • Perform visual audits and user feedback sessions to refine graphics, optimize design elements, and ensure visual coherence across all platforms.

  • Cross-functional Collaboration:

    • Collaborate effectively with other designers, marketers, product managers, developers, and stakeholders to ensure alignment on design goals and objectives.

    • Participate in design reviews, brainstorming sessions, and critiques to provide and receive constructive feedback aimed at improving design solutions.

    • Actively contribute to a positive and creative work environment, sharing knowledge and expertise with team members and contributing to the overall success of the design team.

Skills and Qualifications:

  • Proven experience of 3+ years as a Visual Designer, with a strong portfolio showcasing expertise in marketing design, preferably for a B2B technology product.

  • Proficiency in design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator), Sketch, Figma, or equivalent software.

  • Solid understanding of design principles, typography, color theory, layout, and composition.

  • Experience with responsive design and designing for multiple platforms (web, mobile, etc.).

  • Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to effectively articulate and present design ideas to cross-functional teams and stakeholders.

  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and meet deadlines without compromising quality.

  • Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design, Visual Communication, Interaction Design, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).

Join our team and be part of an exciting journey to create exceptional visual experiences that captivate audiences and drive business success!

Ema Unlimited is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or genetics.

jobs.title: Senior Motion Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us: At Ema we are building the world’s largest agentic AI platform. We are on a mission to 10x workforce productivity by helping enterprises build and deploy their own AI employees. We are backed by marquee investors (Accel, Prosus, SCB10X, Hitachi Ventures, Sozo Ventures to name a few) and have raised over $60M+ till date. Our founders (Surojit Chatterjee and Souvik Sen) have deep experience in building and scaling products from their stints at Google, Coinbase, Flipkart and Okta. 

We are seeking a dynamic and driven senior motion designer to join our team and build out our product marketing motion. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, love building product videos, and creating visually engaging content, we want to hear from you!

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and produce engaging motion graphics and animations for product marketing videos.

  • Collaborate with the marketing and design teams to develop storyboards and concepts.

  • Edit video content to create polished and professional final products, including cutting, trimming, and color correction.

  • Ensure videos are optimized for various platforms (e.g., social media, websites).

  • Maintain a consistent visual style and brand voice across all video content.

  • Stay updated with industry trends and best practices to continuously elevate the quality of our video content.

Qualifications:

  • Proven experience 3+ years as a Motion Designer, preferably in a product-focused environment.

  • Strong portfolio showcasing motion graphics, animations, and video editing skills.

  • Proficiency in software like Adobe After Effects, Premiere Pro, and other relevant video editing tools.

  • Basic understanding of video production processes, including sound design and color grading.

  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

  • Strong communication skills and attention to detail.

Nice-to-Have:

  • Experience creating videos for tech products or SaaS companies.

  • Familiarity with 3D animation tools like Cinema 4D or Blender.

Understanding of digital marketing strategies and how video content can drive engagement.

Ema is the right place for you if you have: 

  • A hustler's mindset with a strong sense of urgency and a bias for action. You should be a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, results-driven environment. 

  • Like to own and drive projects with a high bar on quality. We will always love it if you take ownership of a problem and try to solve it without asking for permission. 

  • Like to measure the impact of everything that you do and set and achieve aggressive goals 

  • Are willing to roll up your sleeves and get things done. We don’t have manager roles at Ema - everyone is expected to do the work of an IC as well. 

  • To get a better understanding of the culture at Ema, please read our values, operating principles and blogs

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.

  • Opportunity to be the principal motion designer and creative head and build the product marketing function for one of the industry’s leaders in the Agentic AI space

  • Chance to learn from seasoned industry executives: Surojit Chatterjee, Souvik Sen, Swati Trehan, Vedant Sharma, Abhiraj Hinge

Ema Unlimited is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or genetics.

How to Apply: Interested candidates should send their resume to vedant@ema.co.

jobs.title: Developer Advocate
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Opportunity Summary:

Ema is building the next generation AI technology to empower every employee in the enterprise to be their most creative and productive. Our proprietary tech allows enterprises to delegate most repetitive tasks to Ema, the Universal AI employee. We are founded by ex-Google, Coinbase, Okta executives, and serial entrepreneurs. We’re well-funded by the top investors and angels in the world. Ema is based in Silicon Valley with offices in Bangalore.

About the Role:

The Developer Advocate will own the end-to-end activation and completion funnel for our partner and customer builders. The core mission of this role is to significantly shorten the time to first value for developers and empower them to build independently on our platform. You will be responsible for creating a cohesive developer journey by integrating documentation, in-product guidance, lifecycle communications, and community programs.

What You'll Do:

  • Documentation & Enablement: Design and build our documentation information architecture, creating a high-quality, comprehensive set of resources for our developers/builders.

  • Lifecycle Marketing: Launch and manage behavior-based lifecycle communications (e.g., welcome series, activation nudges, re-engagement campaigns) to guide developers through the funnel.

  • Community Building: Launch and grow a vibrant developer/builder community, showcase successful projects, and generate valuable case studies.

  • Product-Assisted Enablement: Work with Product and Engineering to improve the first-time user experience with in-product checklists, contextual docs, and other guidance.

  • Metrics & Reporting: Define, track, and report on key success metrics to measure the effectiveness of developer enablement and marketing programs.

Skills and Qualifications:

  1. 5+ years of relevant experience in product marketing, developer relations, developer advocacy, technical marketing, or a similar role.

  2. Experience with Agentic / Generative AI is a must have.

  3. Experience working as a software engineer / developer.

  4. Proven track record of creating and executing successful marketing and enablement programs for a technical audience.

  5. Strong written and verbal communication skills, with an ability to make complex technical concepts easy to understand.

  6. Experience with marketing automation tools and CRM systems.

  7. A data-driven mindset with experience in setting and tracking KPIs.

Join our innovative team and play a key role in shaping the marketing strategy and success of Ema. If you're passionate about marketing, driven by creativity, and excited about the potential of Generative AI, we want to hear from you!
